children.subject: That being said, being given that little time also tells you about what the company/your team might be like lol
Second that thought. Such a team might not be fun to work with.
I personally have found this offer to be a bit disrespectful... It's quite hard to make important decisions within four days...

history.content:
Amazon gave me an exploding offer (less than four business days) and they're not extending the deadline unless UC Berkeley, COE, L&S or the career center have a specific policy on how much time I'm entitled to get. For instance, the career center has a policy that: "For all offers extended for summer internships or full-time employment, including return offers, employers should allow a minimum of three weeks, and preferably more, from the date of the written offer for students to accept or decline. "

The issue is this policy doesn't cover fall internships so I'm screwed. Any other policy out there that would cover exploding offers for fall internships?
history.subject: Is there any policy on exploding offers for fall internships?
